member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.DirectSound3DAlgorithmGuid.NoVirtualization3DAlgorithm
member.summary: 3-D output is mapped into normal left and right stereo panning. At 90 degrees to the left, the sound is coming out of only the left speaker; at 90 degrees to the right, sound is coming out of only the right speaker. The vertical axis is ignored except for scaling of volume due to distance. Doppler shift and volume scaling are still applied, but the 3-D filtering is not performed on this buffer. This is the most efficient software implementation, but provides no virtual 3-D audio effect.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.DirectSound3DAlgorithmGuid.LightHrt3DAlgorithm
member.summary: The 3-D API is processed with the efficient 3-D audio algorithm. This algorithm gives a good 3-D audio effect, but uses fewer CPU cycles than Guid3DAlgorithmHrtfFull

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.DirectSound3DAlgorithmGuid.FullHrt3DAlgorithm
member.summary: The 3-D API is processed with the high quality 3-D audio algorithm. This algorithm gives the highest quality 3-D audio effect, but uses more CPU cycles.

member.summary: Default 3-D algorithm

member.name: M:SlimDX.Quaternion.Lerp(SlimDX.Quaternion@,SlimDX.Quaternion@,System.Single,SlimDX.Quaternion@)
member.summary: Performs a linear interpolation between two quaternions.
member.param: Start quaternion.
End quaternion.
Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
When the method completes, contains the linear interpolation of the two quaternions.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. start + (end - start) * amount Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.summary: The device is a placeholder.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.UnlockTransferRateHardwareBuffers
member.summary: The rate, in kilobytes per second, at which data can be transferred to hardware static sound buffers. This and the number of bytes transferred determines the duration of a call to the Buffer.Read or Buffer.Write method.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.TotalHardwareMemory
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the amount of memory on the sound card that stores static sound buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.SecondaryStereo
member.summary: The device supports hardware-mixed stereo secondary buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.SecondaryMono
member.summary: The device supports hardware-mixed monophonic secondary buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.Secondary8Bit
member.summary: The device supports hardware-mixed secondary sound buffers with 8-bit samples.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.Secondary16Bit
member.summary: The device supports hardware-mixed secondary sound buffers with 16-bit samples.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.PrimaryStereo
member.summary: The device supports stereo primary buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.PrimaryMono
member.summary: The device supports monophonic primary buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.PrimaryBuffers
member.summary: Number of primary buffers supported. This value will always be 1.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.Primary8Bit
member.summary: The device supports primary buffers with 8-bit samples.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.Primary16Bit
member.summary: The device supports a primary buffer with 16-bit samples.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.PlayCpuOverheadSoftwareBuffers
member.summary: The processing overhead, as a percentage of main processor cycles, needed to mix software buffers. This varies according to the bus type, the processor type, and the clock speed.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MinSecondarySampleRate
member.summary: Minimum sample rate specifications that are supported by this device's hardware secondary sound buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxSecondarySampleRate
member.summary: Maximum sample rate specifications that are supported by this device's hardware secondary sound buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardwareMixingStreamingBuffers
member.summary: Maximum number of streaming sound buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardwareMixingStaticBuffers
member.summary: Maximum number of static buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardwareMixingAllBuffers
member.summary: Number of buffers that can be mixed in hardware. This member can be less than the sum of MaxHardwareMixingStaticBuffers and MaxHardwareMixingStreamingBuffers. Resource tradeoffs frequently occur.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardware3DStreamingBuffers
member.summary: Maximum number of streaming 3-D buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardware3DStaticBuffers
member.summary: Maximum number of static 3-D buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxHardware3DAllBuffers
member.summary: Maximum number of 3-D buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.MaxContiguousFreeHardwareMemoryBytes
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the largest contiguous block of free memory on the sound card.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.FreeHardwareMixingStreamingBuffers
member.summary: Number of unallocated streaming buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.FreeHardwareMixingStaticBuffers
member.summary: Number of unallocated static buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.FreeHardwareMixingAllBuffers
member.summary: Number of unallocated buffers. On WDM drivers, this includes FreeHardware3DAllBuffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.FreeHardwareMemory
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the free memory on the sound card.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.FreeHardware3DStreamingBuffers
member.summary: Number of unallocated streaming 3-D buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.FreeHardware3DStaticBuffers
member.summary: Number of unallocated static 3-D buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.FreeHardware3DAllBuffers
member.summary: Number of unallocated 3-D buffers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.EmulatedDriver
member.summary: The device does not have a DirectSound driver installed, so it is being emulated through the waveform-audio functions. Performance degradation should be expected.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.ContinuousRate
member.summary: The device supports all sample rates between the MinSecondarySampleRate and MaxSecondarySampleRate member values. Typically, this means that the actual output rate will be within +/- 10 hertz (Hz) of the requested frequency.

member.name: P:SlimDX.DirectSound.Capabilities.Certified
member.summary: The driver has been tested and certified by Microsoft. This flag is always set for WDM drivers.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration.RightMotorSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the right motor speed.
member.remarks: Valid values are in the range 0 to 65,535. Zero signifies no motor use; 65,535 signifies 100% motor use.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration.LeftMotorSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the left motor speed.
member.remarks: Valid values are in the range 0 to 65,535. Zero signifies no motor use; 65,535 signifies 100% motor use.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.Vibration
member.summary: Specifies motor speed levels for the vibration function of a controller.
member.remarks: The left motor is the low-frequency rumble motor. The right motor is the high-frequency rumble motor. The two motors are not the same, and they create different vibration effects.

member.summary: Gets the right thumbstick y-axis value. The value is between -32768 and 32767.

member.summary: Gets the right thumbstick x-axis value. The value is between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Gamepad.LeftThumbY
member.summary: Gets the left thumbstick y-axis value. The value is between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Gamepad.LeftThumbX
member.summary: Gets the right thumbstick y-axis value. The value is between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Gamepad.RightTrigger
member.summary: Gets the current value of the right trigger analog control. The value is between 0 and 255.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Gamepad.LeftTrigger
member.summary: Gets the current value of the left trigger analog control. The value is between 0 and 255.

member.name: P:SlimDX.XInput.Gamepad.Buttons
member.summary: Gets a set of flags describing the pressed buttons on the gamepad.

member.name: T:SlimDX.XInput.Gamepad
member.summary: Describes the current state of the Xbox 360 Controller.
member.remarks: Each of the thumbstick axis members is a signed value between -32768 and 32767 describing the position of the thumbstick. A value of 0 is centered. Negative values signify down or to the left. Positive values signify up or to the right. The constants GamepadLeftThumbDeadZone or GamepadRightThumbDeadZone can be used as a positive and negative value to filter thumbstick input.

member.name: M:SlimDX.Vector2.DistanceSquared(SlimDX.Vector2,SlimDX.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.summary: Calculates the distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: The distance between the two vectors.

member.name: M:SlimDX.Vector2.Lerp(SlimDX.Vector2@,SlimDX.Vector2@,System.Single,SlimDX.Vector2@)
member.summary: Performs a linear interpolation between two vectors.
member.param: Start vector.
End vector.
Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
When the method completes, contains the linear interpolation of the two vectors.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. start + (end - start) * amount Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.Volume
member.summary: Predefined audio volume attenuation values.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Volume.Maximum
member.summary: Represents the original, unadjusted volume of the stream.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Volume.Minimum
member.summary: Indicates an audio volume attenuated by 100 dB, which, for all practical purposes, is silence.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags
member.summary: Flags specifying the play behavior of the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.TerminateByPriority
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated will be the one with the lowest priority as set by the priority parameter passed to SecondarySoundBuffer::Play for the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.TerminateByDistance
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated will be selected from buffers that have the buffer's BufferFlags::Mute3DAtMaxDistance flag set and are beyond their maximum distance. If there are no such buffers, the method fails.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.TerminateByTime
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing nonlooping buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated is the one with the least time left to play.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.Software
member.summary: Play this voice in a software buffer only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.Hardware
member.summary: Play this voice in a hardware buffer only.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.PlayFlags.Looping
member.summary: Play continues until explicitly stopped. This flag must be set when playing a primary buffer.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.I3DL2ReverbPreset
member.summary: Values that specify a standard reverberation preset.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry
member.summary: Various speaker configurations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry.Maximum
member.summary: The speakers are directed over an arc of 180 degrees.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry.Wide
member.summary: The speakers are directed over an arc of 20 degrees.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry.Narrow
member.summary: The speakers are directed over an arc of 10 degrees.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SpeakerGeometry.Minimum
member.summary: The speakers are directed over an arc of 5 degrees.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult
member.summary: Indicates the result of the attempt to set an effect in the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.Unknown
member.summary: Effect is not registered on the system, and the method failed as a result.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.Failed
member.summary: No effect was created because resources weren't available.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.Unallocated
member.summary: Effect has not yet been assigned to hardware or software. This value is returned if the buffer was created with the BufferFlags::Defer flag in Flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.LocatedInSoftware
member.summary: Effect is instantiated in software.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.LocatedInHardware
member.summary: Effect is instantiated in hardware.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.SoundEffectResult.Present
member.summary: Effect is available but was not created because one of the other effects requested could not be created. If any of the effects requested cannot be created, none of them are, and the call fails.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.Mode3D
member.summary: The 3-D sound processing mode to be set.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Mode3D.Disable
member.summary: Processing of 3D sound is disabled. The sound seems to originate from the center of the listener's head.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Mode3D.HeadRelative
member.summary: Sound parameters (position, velocity, and orientation) are relative to the listener's parameters. In this mode, the absolute parameters of the sound are updated automatically as the listener's parameters change, so that the relative parameters remain constant.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.Mode3D.Normal
member.summary: Normal processing. This is the default mode.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.LockFlags
member.summary: Various sound buffer locking flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.LockFlags.EntireBuffer
member.summary: Lock the entire buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.LockFlags.FromWriteCursor
member.summary: Start the lock at the write cursor.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.CooperativeLevel
member.summary: Values specifying the cooperative level of the device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CooperativeLevel.WritePrimary
member.summary: Sets the write-primary level. The application has write access to the primary buffer. No secondary buffers can be played.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CooperativeLevel.Priority
member.summary: Sets the priority level.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CooperativeLevel.Normal
member.summary: Sets the normal level. This level has the smoothest multitasking and resource-sharing behavior, but because it does not allow the primary buffer format to change, output is restricted to the default 8-bit format.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.CaptureEffectResult
member.summary: Return values for Capture effects.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CaptureEffectResult.LocatedInSoftware
member.summary: Effect is instantiated in software.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.CaptureEffectResult.LocatedInHardware
member.summary: Effect is instantiated in hardware.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus
member.summary: Flags specifying the status of the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Terminated
member.summary: The buffer was prematurely terminated by the voice manager and is not playing. Set only for buffers created with the BufferFlags::Defer flag.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Software
member.summary: The buffer is playing in software. Set only for buffers created with the BufferFlags::Defer flag.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Hardware
member.summary: The buffer is playing in hardware. Set only for buffers created with the BufferFlags::Defer flag.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Looping
member.summary: The buffer is being looped. If this value is not set, the buffer will stop when it reaches the end of the sound data. This value is returned only in combination with BufferStatus::Playing.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.BufferLost
member.summary: The buffer is lost and must be restored before it can be played or locked.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferStatus.Playing
member.summary: The buffer is playing. If this value is not set, the buffer is stopped.

member.name: T:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags
member.summary: Flags specifying the capabilities of the buffer.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Defer
member.summary: The buffer can be assigned to a hardware or software resource at play time.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Mute3DAtMaxDistance
member.summary: The sound is reduced to silence at the maximum distance. The buffer will stop playing when the maximum distance is exceeded, so that processor time is not wasted. Applies only to software buffers.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.GetCurrentPosition2
member.summary: The buffer uses the new behavior of the play cursor when retrieving the current position.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.GlobalFocus
member.summary: The buffer is a global sound buffer. With this flag set, an application using DirectSound can continue to play its buffers if the user switches focus to another application, even if the new application uses DirectSound.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.StickyFocus
member.summary: The buffer has sticky focus. If the user switches to another application not using DirectSound, the buffer is still audible. However, if the user switches to another DirectSound application, the buffer is muted.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlEffects
member.summary: The buffer supports effects processing.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlPositionNotify
member.summary: The buffer has position notification capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlVolume
member.summary: The buffer has volume control capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlPan
member.summary: The buffer has pan control capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.ControlFrequency
member.summary: The buffer has frequency control capability.

member.name: F:SlimDX.DirectSound.BufferFlags.Control3D

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.DoNotSplit
member.summary: While attribute sorting, do not split vertices that are shared between attribute groups.

member.summary: Optimize the faces only; do not optimize the vertices.

member.summary: Reorders faces to maximize length of adjacent triangles.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.VertexCache
member.summary: Reorders faces to increase the cache hit rate of vertex caches.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.AttributeSort
member.summary: Reorders faces to optimize for fewer attribute bundle state changes and enhanced draw performance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D10.MeshOptimizeFlags.Compact
member.summary: Reorders faces to remove unused vertices and faces.

member.name: M:SlimDX.Matrix.Lerp(SlimDX.Matrix@,SlimDX.Matrix@,System.Single,SlimDX.Matrix@)
member.summary: Performs a linear interpolation between two matricies.
member.param: Start matrix.
End matrix.
Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
When the method completes, contains the linear interpolation of the two matricies.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. start + (end - start) * amount Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.name: M:SlimDX.Vector3.DistanceSquared(SlimDX.Vector3,SlimDX.Vector3)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. start + (end - start) * amount Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation
member.summary: Defines per-stage texture blending operations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Lerp
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between the second and third source arguments by a proportion specified in the first source argument.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.MultiplyAdd
member.summary: Performs a multiply-accumulate operation. It takes the last two arguments, multiplies them together, and adds them to the remaining input/source argument, and places that into the result.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.DotProduct3
member.summary: Modulate the components of each argument as signed components, add their products; then replicate the sum to all color channels, including alpha.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BumpEnvironmentMapLuminance
member.summary: Perform per-pixel bump mapping, using the environment map in the next stage, with luminance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BumpEnvironmentMap
member.summary: Perform per-pixel bump mapping, using the environment map in the next stage.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.ModulateInvColorAddAlpha
member.summary: Modulate the arguments, inverting the first argument, then add the alpha of the first argument.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.ModulateInvAlphaAddColor
member.summary: Modulate the color of the second argument, using the inverted alpha from the first argument, and then add the result to argument one.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.ModulateColorAddAlpha
member.summary: Modulate the arguments, then add the alpha of the first argument.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.ModulateAlphaAddColor
member.summary: Modulate the color of the second argument, using the alpha from the first argument, and then add the result to argument one.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Premodulate
member.summary: Premodulate the arguments with the next stage's values.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendCurrentAlpha
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using the alpha from the previous stage.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendTextureAlphaPM
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using a premultiplied alpha.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendFactorAlpha
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using the current texture factor.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendTextureAlpha
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using the alpha from the stage's texture.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.BlendDiffuseAlpha
member.summary: Linearly blend the current stage, using the interpolated alpha from each vertex.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.AddSmooth
member.summary: Add the first and second arguments, and then subtract their product from the sum.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Subtract
member.summary: Subtract the components of the second argument from the components of the first argument.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.AddSigned2X
member.summary: Add the components of the arguments with a -0.5 bias, and then multiply them by 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.AddSigned
member.summary: Add the components of the arguments with a -0.5 bias.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Add
member.summary: Add the components of the arguments.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Modulate4X
member.summary: Multiply the components of the arguments, and then multiply them by 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Modulate2X
member.summary: Multiply the components of the arguments, and then multiply them by 2.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Modulate
member.summary: Multiply the components of the arguments.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.SelectArg2
member.summary: Use the current stage's second color or alpha argument, unmodified, as the output.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.SelectArg1
member.summary: Use the current stage's first color or alpha argument, unmodified, as the output.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TextureOperation.Disable
member.summary: Disabled output from the current stage and all higher stages.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState
member.summary: Sampler states define texture sampling operations such as texture addressing and texture filtering. Some sampler states set-up vertex processing, and some set-up pixel processing. Sampler states can be saved and restored using stateblocks

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.DisplacementMapOffset
member.summary: An integer value that specifies the vertex offset into a presampled displacement map. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.ElementIndex
member.summary: An integer value that specifies which element of a multielement texture to use. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.SrgbTexture
member.summary: An integer value that specifies sRGB gamma correction. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.MaxAnisotropy
member.summary: An integer value that specifies the maximum anisotropy level. The default value is 1.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.MaxMipLevel
member.summary: An integer value that specifies the maximum mipmap level. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.MipMapLodBias
member.summary: An integer value that specifies the level-of-detail bias. The default value is 0.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.MipFilter
member.summary: Specifies the mipmap filter. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Point.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.MinFilter
member.summary: Specifies the minification filter. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Point.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.MagFilter
member.summary: Specifies the magnification filter. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Point.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.BorderColor
member.summary: Specifies the texture border color. Use packed integer color values to set this state. The default value is 0 (black).

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.AddressW
member.summary: Specifies the texture address mode for the W coordinate. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Wrap.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.AddressV
member.summary: Specifies the texture address mode for the V coordinate. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Wrap.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SamplerState.AddressU
member.summary: Specifies the texture address mode for the U coordinate. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Wrap.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState
member.summary: Render states define set-up states for all kinds of vertex and pixel processing. Some render states set up vertex processing, and some set up pixel processing. Render states can be saved and restored using stateblocks.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.BlendOperationAlpha
member.summary: Specifies the operation to perform for separate alpha blending. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Add.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.DestinationBlendAlpha
member.summary: Specifies the destination alpha blending function. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Zero.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.SourceBlendAlpha
member.summary: Specifies the source alpha blending function. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .One.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.SeparateAlphaBlendEnable
member.summary: Set this state to true to enable separate blending modes for the alpha channel, and false to disable them. The default value is false.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.DepthBias
member.summary: A floating point value that is used for comparison of depth values.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.SrgbWriteEnable
member.summary: Set this state to true to enable sRGB gamma correction, and false to disable it. The default value is false.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.BlendFactor
member.summary: Specifies a color to use as a constant blend factor for alpha blending. Use integer color values to set this state. The default value is 0xFFFFFFFF (white).

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.ColorWriteEnable3
member.summary: Specifies additional color write enable settings for the device. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .All".

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.ColorWriteEnable2
member.summary: Specifies additional color write enable settings for the device. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .All".

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.ColorWriteEnable1
member.summary: Specifies additional color write enable settings for the device. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .All".

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.CcwStencilFunc
member.summary: Specifies the comparison function for stencil tests.. Use values from to set the state. The default value is .Always".

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.CcwStencilPass
member.summary: Specifies the operation to perform if both the stencil and depth tests pass. Use values from to set the state. The default value is .Keep".

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.CcwStencilZFail
member.summary: Specifies the operation to perform if the stencil test passes and depth test fails. Use values from to set the state. The default value is .Keep".

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.CcwStencilFail
member.summary: Specifies the operation to perform if the stencil test fails. Use values from to set the state. The default value is .Keep".

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.TwoSidedStencilMode
member.summary: Set this state to true to enable two sided stenciling, and false to disable it. The default value is false.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.EnableAdaptiveTessellation

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.MinTessellationLevel

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.PositionDegree

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.BlendOperation

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.TweenFactor

member.summary: An integer value that specifies which user-defined clip planes are active. Use

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.VertexBlend
member.summary: An integer value that specifies the number of matrices to use to perform geometry blending. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Disable.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.EmissiveMaterialSource
member.summary: Specifies the source for emissive colors. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Material.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.AmbientMaterialSource
member.summary: Specifies the source for ambient colors. Use values from to set this state. The default value is .Material.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.SpecularMaterialSource

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.NormalizeNormals
member.summary: Set this state to true to enable automatic normalization of vertex normals, and false to disable it. The default value is false.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.LocalViewer

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.ColorVertex
member.summary: Set this state to true to enable colored vertices, and false to disable them. The default value is true.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.RenderState.FogVertexMode

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.VertexFormatCaps.DoNotStripElements
member.summary: It is preferable that vertex elements not be stripped. That is, if the vertex format contains elements that are not used with the current render states, there is no need to regenerate the vertices. If this capability flag is not present, stripping extraneous elements from the vertex format provides better performance.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags
member.summary: Specifies options for welding together vertices.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags.DoNotSplit
member.summary: Instructs the weld not to split vertices that are in separate attribute groups.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags.DoNotRemoveVertices
member.summary: Instructs the weld to allow only modifications to vertices and not removal. This flag is valid only if WeldPartialMatches is set. It is useful to modify vertices to be equal, but not to allow vertices to be removed.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags.WeldPartialMatches
member.summary: If a given vertex component is within epsilon, modify partially matched vertices so that both components are identical. If all components are equal, remove one of the vertices.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.WeldFlags.WeldAll
member.summary: Weld together all vertices that are at the same location.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TransitionType
member.summary: Defines the transition style between values of a mesh animation.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TransitionType.EaseInEaseOut
member.summary: Ease-in, ease-out spline transition between values.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TransitionType.Linear
member.summary: Linear transition between values.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TrackPriority
member.summary: Defines the priority type to which an animation track is assigned.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TrackPriority.High
member.summary: Track should be blended with all the high-priority tracks before the high-priority blend is mixed with the low-priority blend.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TrackPriority.Low
member.summary: Track should be blended with all the low-priority tracks before the low-priority blend is mixed with the high-priority blend.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions
member.summary: Defines settings used for mesh tangent frame computations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.GenerateInPlace
member.summary: The results are stored in the original input mesh, and the output mesh is not used.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.CalculateNormals
member.summary: Compute the per-vertex normal vector for each triangle of the input mesh, and ignore any normal vectors already in the input mesh.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WindCW
member.summary: Vertices are ordered in a clockwise direction around each triangle. The computed normal vector direction is therefore inverted 180 degrees from the direction computed using counterclockwise vertex ordering.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WeightEqual
member.summary: Compute a unit-length normal vector for each triangle of the input mesh. Mutually exclusive with WeightByArea.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WeightByArea
member.summary: Weight the direction of the computed per-vertex normal or partial derivative vector according to the areas of triangles attached to that vertex. Mutually exclusive with WeightEqual.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.OrthogonalizeFromU
member.summary: Compute the partial derivative with respect to texture coordinate u independently for each vertex, and then compute the partial derivative with respect to V as the cross product of the normal vector and the partial derivative with respect to U. Mutually exclusive with DontOrthogonalize and OrthogonalizeFromV.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.OrthogonalizeFromV
member.summary: Compute the partial derivative with respect to texture coordinate V independently for each vertex, and then compute the partial derivative with respect to U as the cross product of the partial derivative with respect to V and the normal vector. Mutually exclusive with DontOrthogonalize and OrthogonalizeFromU.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.DontOrthogonalize
member.summary: Do not transform texture coordinates to orthogonal Cartesian coordinates. Mutually exclusive with OrthogonalizeFromU and OrthogonalizeFromV.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.DontNormalizePartials
member.summary: Do not normalize partial derivatives with respect to texture coordinates. If not normalized, the scale of the partial derivatives is proportional to the scale of the 3D model divided by the scale of the triangle in (U, V) space. This scale value provides a measure of how much the texture is stretched in a given direction. The resulting vector length is a weighted sum of the lengths of the partial derivatives.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WrapUV
member.summary: Texture coordinate values in both U and V directions are between 0 and 1. In this case a texture coordinate set will be chosen that minimizes the perimeter of the triangle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WrapV
member.summary: Texture coordinate values in the V direction are between 0 and 1. In this case a texture coordinate set will be chosen that minimizes the perimeter of the triangle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.WrapU
member.summary: Texture coordinate values in the U direction are between 0 and 1. In this case a texture coordinate set will be chosen that minimizes the perimeter of the triangle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.TangentOptions.None
member.summary: No options.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags
member.summary: Flags used to specify sprite rendering options to the flags parameter in the Sprite.Begin method.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.DoNotAddRefTexture
member.summary: Disables calling AddRef() on every draw, and Release() on Flush() for better performance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.SortDepthBackToFront
member.summary: Sprites are sorted by depth in back-to-front order prior to drawing. This procedure is recommended when drawing transparent sprites of varying depths. You may combine SortDepthBackToFront with SortTexture to sort first by depth, and second by texture.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.SortDepthFrontToBack
member.summary: Sprites are sorted by depth in front-to-back order prior to drawing. This procedure is recommended when drawing opaque sprites of varying depths. You may combine SortDepthFrontToBack with SortTexture to sort first by depth, and second by texture.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.SortTexture
member.summary: Sort sprites by texture prior to drawing. This can improve performance when drawing non-overlapping sprites of uniform depth. You may also combine SortTexture with either SortDepthFrontToBack or SortDepthBackToFront. This will sort the list of sprites by depth first and texture second.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.AlphaBlend
member.summary: Enables alpha blending with RenderState.AlphaTestEnable set to true (for nonzero alpha). Blend.SourceAlpha will be the source blend state, and Blend.InverseSourceAlpha will be the destination blend state in calls to Device.SetRenderState. Font expects this flag to be set when drawing text.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.Billboard
member.summary: Each sprite will be rotated about its center so that it is facing the viewer. Sprite.SetWorldViewLH or Sprite.SetWorldViewRH must be called first.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.ObjectSpace
member.summary: The world, view, and projection transforms are not modified. The transforms currently set to the device are used to transform the sprites when the batched sprites are drawn (when Sprite.Flush or Sprite.End is called). If this flag is not specified, then world, view, and projection transforms are modified so that sprites are drawn in screen-space coordinates.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.DoNotModifyRenderState
member.summary: The device render state is not to be changed when Sprite.Begin is called. The device is assumed to be in a valid state to draw vertices containing UsageIndex = 0 in the DeclarationUsage.Position, DeclarationUsage.TexCoord, and DeclarationUsage.Color data.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.DoNotSaveState
member.summary: The device state is not to be saved or restored when Sprite.Begin or Sprite.End is called.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.SpriteFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags
member.summary: Flags used for parsing, compiling, or assembling shaders.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.UseLegacyD3DX9_31Dll
member.summary: Enable the use of the original Direct3D 9 HLSL compiler. OCT2006_d3dx9_31_x86.cab or OCT2006_d3dx9_31_x64.cab must be included as part of the applications redist. This flag is required to compile ps_1_x shaders without using the promotion flag to ps_2_0. Specifying this flag when obtaining an EffectCompiler interface causes subsequent calls to EffectCompiler.CompileEffect and EffectCompiler/CompileShader through this object to use the legacy compiler.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.SkipOptimization
member.summary: Do not validate the generated code against known capabilities and constraints. This option is recommended only when compiling shaders that are known to work (that is, shaders that have compiled before without this option). Shaders are always validated by the runtime before they are set to the device.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.SkipValidation
member.summary: Instruct the compiler to skip optimization steps during code generation. Unless you are trying to isolate a problem in your code and you suspect the compiler, using this option is not recommended.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.PreferFlowControl
member.summary: This is a hint to the compiler to prefer using flow-control instructions.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.PartialPrecision
member.summary: Force all computations in the resulting shader to occur at partial precision This may result in faster evaluation of shaders on some hardware.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel3
member.summary: Highest optimization level. Will produce best possible code but may take significantly longer to do so. This will be useful for final builds of an application where performance is the most important factor.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel2
member.summary: Second highest optimization level.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel1
member.summary: Second lowest optimization level.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.OptimizationLevel0
member.summary: Lowest optimization level. May produce slower code but will do so more quickly. This may be useful in a highly iterative shader development cycle.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.NoPreshader
member.summary: Disables preshaders. The compiler will not pull out static expressions for evaluation on the host CPU. Additionally, the compiler will not loft any expressions when compiling stand-alone functions.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.IeeeStrictness
member.summary: Disable optimizations that may cause the output of a compiled shader program to differ from the output of a program compiled with the DirectX 9 shader compiler due to small precision erros in floating point math.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.ForceVSSoftwareNoOpt
member.summary: Force the compiler to compile against the next highest available software target for vertex shaders. This flag also turns optimizations off and debugging on.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.ForcePSSoftwareNoOpt
member.summary: Force the compiler to compile against the next highest available software target for pixel shaders. This flag also turns optimizations off and debugging on.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.EnableBackwardsCompatibility
member.summary: Compile ps_1_x shaders as ps_2_0. Effects that specify ps_1_x targets will instead compile to ps_2_0 targets because this is the minimum shader version supported by the DirectX 10 shader compiler. This flag has no effect when used with higher level compile targets.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.Debug
member.summary: Insert debug filename, line numbers, and type and symbol information during shader compile.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.AvoidFlowControl
member.summary: This is a hint to the compiler to avoid using flow-control instructions.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.PackMatrixRowMajor
member.summary: Unless explicitly specified, matrices will be packed in row-major order (each vector will be in a single row) when passed to or from the shader.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.PackMatrixColumnMajor
member.summary: Unless explicitly specified, matrices will be packed in column-major order (each vector will be in a single column) when passed to and from the shader. This is generally more efficient because it allows vector-matrix multiplication to be performed using a series of dot products.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.ShaderFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.NormalMapFlags.ComputeOcclusion
member.summary: Computes the per-pixel occlusion term and encodes it into the alpha. An alpha of 1 means that the pixel is not obscured in any way, and an alpha of 0 means that the pixel is completely obscured.

member.summary: Inverts the direction of each normal.

member.summary: Same as specifying the MirrorU and MirrorV flags.

member.summary: Indicates that pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.summary: The mesh will be simplified by the number of faces specified in the MinValue parameter.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshSimplification.Vertex
member.summary: The mesh will be simplified by the number of vertices specified in the MinValue parameter.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags
member.summary: Specifies the type of mesh optimization to be performed.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.DeviceIndependent
member.summary: Affects the vertex cache size. Using this flag specifies a default vertex cache size that works well on legacy hardware.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.DoNotSplit
member.summary: While attribute sorting, do not split vertices that are shared between attribute groups.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.IgnoreVertices
member.summary: Optimize the faces only; do not optimize the vertices.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.StripReorder
member.summary: Reorders faces to maximize length of adjacent triangles.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.VertexCache
member.summary: Reorders faces to increase the cache hit rate of vertex caches.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.AttributeSort
member.summary: Reorders faces to optimize for fewer attribute bundle state changes and enhanced BaseMesh.DrawSubset performance.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshOptimizeFlags.Compact
member.summary: Reorders faces to remove unused vertices and faces.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.WriteOnly

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.MeshFlags.UseHardwareOnly
member.summary: Use hardware processing only. For mixed-mode device, this flag will cause the system to use hardware (if supported in hardware) or will default to software processing.

member.summary: Forces the cloned meshes to share vertex buffers.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.FX.DoNotSaveShaderState
member.summary: A stateblock saves state when calling Effect.Begin and restores state when calling Effect.End.

member.summary: No state is saved when calling Effect.Begin or restored when calling Effect.End.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter
member.summary: Flags used to specify what filters to use when processing an image.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.SrgbOut
member.summary: The output data is in sRGB (gamma 2.2) color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.SrgbIn
member.summary: Input data is in sRGB (gamma 2.2) color space.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Srgb
member.summary: Specifying this flag is the same as specifying the SrgbIn and SrgbOut flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Dither
member.summary: The resulting image must be dithered using a 4x4 ordered dither algorithm.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Mirror
member.summary: Specifying this flag is the same as specifying the MirrorU, MirrorV, and MirrorW flags.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.MirrorW
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the w-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.MirrorV
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the v-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.MirrorU
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Box
member.summary: Each pixel is computed by averaging a 2x2(x2) box of pixels from the source image. This filter works only when the dimensions of the destination are half those of the source, as is the case with mipmaps.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Triangle
member.summary: Every pixel in the source image contributes equally to the destination image. This is the slowest of the filters.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Linear
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the four nearest pixels from the source image. This filter works best when the scale on both axes is less than two.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Point
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the nearest pixel from the source image.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.None
member.summary: No scaling or filtering will take place. Pixels outside the bounds of the source image are assumed to be transparent black.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.Filter.Default
member.summary: Uses the default behavior.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType
member.summary: Defines operations to perform on vertices in preparation for mesh cleaning.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.Simplification
member.summary: Use this flag to prevent infinite loops during mesh simplification operations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.Optimization
member.summary: Use this flag to prevent infinite loops during mesh optimization operations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.Skinning
member.summary: Use this flag to prevent infinite loops during skinning setup mesh operations.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.Bowties
member.summary: If a vertex is the apex of two triangle fans (a bowtie) and mesh operations will affect one of the fans, then split the shared vertex into two new vertices. Bowties can cause problems for operations such as mesh simplification that remove vertices, because removing one vertex affects two distinct sets of triangles.

member.name: F:SlimDX.Direct3D9.CleanType.BackFacing
member.summary: Merge triangles that share the same vertex indices but have face normals pointing in opposite directions (back-facing triangles). Unless the triangles are not split by adding a replicated vertex, mesh adjacency data from the two triangles may conflict.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Configuration.DetectDoubleDispose
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SlimDX detects double disposal of objects. If set to true, SlimDX will throw an when an already disposed object is disposed. If set to false, double disposals will be silently ignored. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Configuration.ThrowOnError
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SlimDX defaults to throwing exceptions on result codes that indicate errors. The default value is true.

member.name: P:SlimDX.Configuration.EnableObjectTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether SlimDX is currently tracking call stacks from object creation. If set to false, objects will not carry a call stack from when they were created. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Object tracking is a useful debugging facility, but may have a significant negative impact on performance. The default value is false.

member.name: T:SlimDX.Configuration
member.summary: Used to control global options that affect all of SlimDX.
